title: Variables
text: Represent the number of each type of pass using variables.The number of tournament passes sold was 37 more than the number of day passes sold, which you can represent as $$d+37$$, and you can represent day passes simply as d.

title: Multiplication
text: Multiply the number of each pass type(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their monetary values into a single equation. This will be $$\operatorname{30}\left(d+7\right)+20d=17610$$.

title: Substitution
text: Plug d into the original relationship between the passes to find t.

title: Calculation
text: The answer is 330 day passes and 367 tournament passes.
